subject: p18224196
History: Year old woman with urosepsis s/p intubation, eval for interval changes.
Findings: The lungs are hyperinflated. There is an increased opacity in the left upper lobe likely atelectasis, attention on follow-up studies needed There is no pneumothorax. Cardiac size is mildly enlarged. Lines and tubes in standard positions, no change. Again seen in the median sternotomy wires. Patient status post MVR and AVR.
Impression: Increased opacity in the left upper lobe may be atelectasis but attention on follow-up studies is needed.
